ranked_diseases.explanation: Atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor (AT/RT) is a hallmark feature of Rhabdoid Tumor Predisposition Syndrome 1 (RTPS1), which is caused by germline mutations in the SMARCB1 gene. This is the most common genetic predisposition to AT/RT, especially in young children like the patient (P3Y).

Atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor (AT/RT) can also be associated with Rhabdoid Tumor Predisposition Syndrome 2 (RTPS2), which is caused by germline mutations in the SMARCA4 gene. While less common than RTPS1, it is a recognized genetic predisposition for AT/RT.
